properties.name: class
properties.description:
Add one or more CSS classes to the table element e.g. table table-striped table-bordered.

Default: table
properties.rawdescription:
Add one or more CSS classes to the table element e.g. `table table-striped table-bordered`.

**Default:** `table`

properties.name: disableTableSort
properties.description:
Disable sorting of table data, useful when sorting is handled externally e.g. server-side pagination. Table will still use sortOrder to visually show how the data is sorted.

Default: false
properties.rawdescription:
Disable sorting of table data, useful when sorting is handled externally e.g. server-side pagination. Table will still use sortOrder to visually show how the data is sorted.

**Default:** `false`

properties.name: mobileLayout
properties.description:
Allows for a more mobile friendly layout by displaying columns as rows instead. This is accomplished with css by adding table-mobile class to table element and adding column headers as data labels to each row.

Default: false
properties.rawdescription:
Allows for a more mobile friendly layout by displaying columns as rows instead. This is accomplished with css by adding `table-mobile` class to table element and adding column headers as data labels to each row.

**Default:** `false`

properties.name: stickyHeaders
properties.description:
Make row and/or column headers sticky by adding gt-sticky-row-header and gt-sticky-column-header to table to alter table behaviour using css. Please note that in order for headers to be sticky, table can't be placed inside element with overflow set to auto.

Default: {row:false, column:false}
properties.rawdescription:
Make row and/or column headers sticky by adding `gt-sticky-row-header` and `gt-sticky-column-header` to table to alter table behaviour using css. Please note that in order for headers to be sticky, table can't be placed inside element with overflow set to auto.

**Default:** `{row:false, column:false}`

components.templateData: Example

components.name: CoreComponent

outputsClass.name: pageChange
outputsClass.rawdescription: page change event - emitted when current page/index changes for pagination
outputsClass.description: page change event - emitted when current page/index changes for pagination

propertiesClass.name: _pagingInfo$
calculations$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
combineLatest([this.data$, this.tableConfig$]).pipe(
    map(([data, config]) => calculate(data, config)),
    shareReplay(1)
  )

propertiesClass.name: colspan$
currentPaginationIndex$
data$
footerColspan$
rowHover$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this._rowHover$.asObservable().pipe(
    debounceTime(50),
    distinctUntilChanged((p, q) => p.index === q.index),
    tap((event) => this.rowHover.emit(event)),
    shareReplay(1)
  )

propertiesClass.name: searchBy$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this._searchBy$.pipe(
    startWith(''),
    map((value) => (isObservable(value) ? value : of(value))),
    switchMap((obs) => obs),
    shareReplay(1)
  )

propertiesClass.name: table$
tableConfig$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this._tableConfig$.pipe(
    map((value) => (isObservable(value) ? value : of(value))),
    switchMap((obs) => obs),
    shareReplay(1)
  )
